title: Addition is Associative
description:
Prove that addition of natural numbers is associative: `(n + m) + p = n + (m + p)`.

**Goal:** `forall n m p : nat, (n + m) + p = n + (m + p)`

This is another fundamental property of addition that requires careful induction.
hints: Perform induction on n (the leftmost variable often works best)
The base case: (0 + m) + p = 0 + (m + p) simplifies by definition
For the inductive case, use simpl to reduce S n + m to S (n + m)
Then apply the inductive hypothesis and reflexivity
template:
Theorem add_assoc : forall n m p : nat, (n + m) + p = n + (m + p).
Proof.
  (* Your proof here *)
Admitted.
solution:
Theorem add_assoc : forall n m p : nat, (n + m) + p = n + (m + p).
Proof.
  intros n m p.
  induction n as [| n' IHn'].
  - simpl. reflexivity.
  - simpl. rewrite IHn'. reflexivity.
Qed.
